basic.name: basic
basic.label: Adobe XMP Basic namespace
basic.definition: The XMP basic namespace contains properties that provide basic descriptive information.

xmp:Label.name: Label
xmp:Label.definition: A word or short phrase that identifies a resource as a member of a userdefined collection. NOTE: One anticipated usage is to organize resources in a file browser.

xmp:CreateDate.name: CreateDate
xmp:CreateDate.definition: The date and time the resource was created. For a digital file, this need not match a file-system creation time. For a freshly created resource, it should be close to that time, modulo the time taken to write the file. Later file transfer, copying, and so on, can make the file-system time arbitrarily different.

xmp:CreatorTool.name: CreatorTool
xmp:CreatorTool.definition: The name of the first known tool used to create the resource.

xmp:Identifier.name: Identifier
xmp:Identifier.definition: An unordered array of text strings that unambiguously identify the resource within a given context. An array item may be qualified with xmpidq:Scheme to denote the formal identification system to which that identifier conforms. NOTE: The xmp:Identifier property was added because dc:identifier has been defined in the original XMP specification as a single identifier instead of as an array, and changing dc:identifier to an array would break compatibility with existing XMP processors.

xmp:MetadataDate.name: MetadataDate
xmp:MetadataDate.definition: The date and time that any metadata for this resource was last changed. It should be the same as or more recent than xmp:ModifyDate.

xmp:ModifyDate.name: ModifyDate
xmp:ModifyDate.definition: The date and time the resource was last modified. NOTE: The value of this property is not necessarily the same as the file’s system modification date because it is typically set before the file is saved.

xmp:Rating.name: Rating
xmp:Rating.definition: A user-assigned rating for this file. The value shall be -1 or in the range [0..5], where -1 indicates “rejected” and 0 indicates “unrated”. If xmp:Rating is not present, a value of 0 should be assumed. NOTE: Anticipated usage is for a typical “star rating” UI, with the addition of a notion of rejection.

xmp:BaseURL.name: BaseURL
xmp:BaseURL.definition: The base URL for relative URLs in the document content. If this document contains Internet links, and those links are relative, they are relative to this base URL. This property provides a standard way for embedded relative URLs to be interpreted by tools. Web authoring tools should set the value based on their notion of where URLs will be interpreted.

xmp:Nickname.name: Nickname
xmp:Nickname.definition: A short informal name for the resource.

xmp:Thumbnail.name: Thumbnail
xmp:Thumbnail.definition: An alternative array of thumbnail images for a file, which can differ in characteristics such as size or image encoding.

media_management.name: media_management
media_management.label: XMP Media Management namespace
media_management.definition: This namespace is primarily for use by digital asset management (DAM) systems.

xmpMM:DerivedFrom.name: derivedFrom
xmpMM:DerivedFrom.definition: A reference to the original document from which this one is derived. It is a minimal reference; missing components can be assumed to be unchanged. For example, a new version might only need to specify the instance ID and version number of the previous version, or a rendition might only need to specify the instance ID and rendition class of the original.

xmpMM:DocumentID.name: documentID
xmpMM:DocumentID.definition: The common identifier for all versions and renditions of a resource. It should be based on a UUID; Created once for new resources. Different renditions are expected to have different values for xmpMM:DocumentID.

xmpMM:InstanceID.name: instanceID
xmpMM:InstanceID.definition: An identifier for a specific incarnation of a resource, updated each time a file is saved. It should be based on a UUID.

xmpMM:OriginalDocumentID.name: originalDocumentID
xmpMM:OriginalDocumentID.definition: The common identifier for the original resource from which the current resource is derived. For example, if you save a resource to a different format, then save that one to another format, each save operation should generate a new xmpMM:DocumentID that uniquely identifies the resource in that format, but should retain the ID of the source file here. It links a resource to its original source.

xmpMM:RenditionClass.name: renditionClass
xmpMM:RenditionClass.definition: The rendition class name for this resource. This property should be absent or set to default for a document version that is not a derived rendition.

xmpMM:RenditionParams.name: renditionParams
xmpMM:RenditionParams.definition: Can be used to provide additional rendition parameters that are too complex or verbose to encode in xmpMM: RenditionClass.

xmpMM:History.name: history
xmpMM:History.definition: An ordered array of high-level user actions that resulted in this resource. It is intended to give human readers a description of the steps taken to make the changes from the previous version to this one. The list should be at an abstract level; it is not intended to be an exhaustive keystroke or other detailed history. The description should be sufficient for metadata management, as well as for workflow enhancement.

xmpMM:Ingredients.name: ingredients
xmpMM:Ingredients.definition: References to resources that were incorporated, by inclusion or reference, into this resource.

xmpMM:Pantry.name: pantry
xmpMM:Pantry.definition: Each array item has a structure value with a potentially unique set of fields, containing extracted XMP from a component. Each field is a property from the XMP of a contained resource component, with all substructure preserved. Each pantry entry shall contain an xmpMM:InstanceID. Only one copy of the pantry entry for any given xmpMM:InstanceID shall be retained in the pantry. Nested pantry items shall be removed from the individual pantry item and promoted to the top level of the pantry.

xmpMM:ManagedFrom.name: managedFrom
xmpMM:ManagedFrom.definition: A reference to the document as it was prior to becoming managed. It is set when a managed document is introduced to an asset management system that does not currently own it. It may or may not include references to different management systems.

xmpMM:Manager.name: manager
xmpMM:Manager.definition: The name of the asset management system that manages this resource. Along with xmpMM: ManagerVariant, it tells applications which asset management system to contact concerning this document.

xmpMM:ManageTo.name: manageTo
xmpMM:ManageTo.definition: A URI identifying the managed resource to the asset management system; the presence of this property is the formal indication that this resource is managed. The form and content of this URI is private to the asset management system.

xmpMM:ManageUI.name: manageUI
xmpMM:ManageUI.definition: A URI that can be used to access information about the managed resource through a web browser. It might require a custom browser plug-in.

xmpMM:ManagerVariant.name: managerVariant
xmpMM:ManagerVariant.definition: Specifies a particular variant of the asset management system. The format of this property is private to the specific asset management system.

xmpMM:VersionID.name: versionID
xmpMM:VersionID.definition: The document version identifier for this resource. Each version of a document gets a new identifier, usually simply by incrementing integers 1, 2, 3 . . . and so on. Media management systems can have other conventions or support branching which requires a more complex scheme.

xmpMM:Versions.name: versions
xmpMM:Versions.definition: The version history associated with this resource. Entry 1 is the oldest known version for this document, entry[last()] is the most recent version. Typically, a media management system would fill in the version information in the metadata on check-in. It is not guaranteed that a complete history of versions from the first to this one will be present in the xmpMM:Versions property. Interior version information can be compressed or eliminated and the version history can be truncated at some point.

basic_job_ticket.name: basic_job_ticket
basic_job_ticket.label: Basic Job Ticket namespace
basic_job_ticket.definition: This namespace describes very simple workflow or job information.

xmpBJ:JobRef.name: jobRef
xmpBJ:JobRef.definition: References an external job management file for a job process in which the document is being used. Use of job names is under user control. Typical use would be to identify all documents that are part of a particular job or contract. There are multiple values because there can be more than one job using a particular document at any time, and it can also be useful to keep historical information about what jobs a document was part of previously.

paged_text.name: paged_text
paged_text.label: XMP Paged-Text namespace
paged_text.definition: The Paged-Text namespace is used for text appearing on a page in a document.

xmpTPg:Colorants.name: colorants
xmpTPg:Colorants.definition: An ordered array of colorants (swatches) that are used in the document (including any in contained documents).

xmpTPg:Fonts.name: fonts
xmpTPg:Fonts.definition: An unordered array of fonts that are used in the document (including any in contained documents).

xmpTPg:MaxPageSize.name: maxPageSize
xmpTPg:MaxPageSize.definition: The size of the largest page in the document (including any in contained documents).

xmpTPg:NPages.name: nPages
xmpTPg:NPages.definition: The number of pages in the document (including any in contained documents).

xmpTPg:PlateNames.name: plateNames
xmpTPg:PlateNames.definition: An ordered array of plate names that are needed to print the document (including any in contained documents).

dynamic_media.name: dynamic_media
dynamic_media.label: XMP Dynamic Media namespace
dynamic_media.definition: This namespace specifies properties used by the Adobe dynamic media group.

xmpDM:absPeakAudioFilePath.name: absPeakAudioFilePath
xmpDM:absPeakAudioFilePath.definition: The absolute path to the file’s peak audio file. If empty, no peak file exists.

xmpDM:altTapeName.name: altTapeName
xmpDM:altTapeName.definition: An alternative tape name, set via the project window or timecode dialog in Premiere. If an alternative name has been set and has not been reverted, that name is displayed.

xmpDM:altTimecode.name: altTimecode
xmpDM:altTimecode.definition: A timecode set by the user. When specified, it is used instead of the startTimecode.

xmpDM:artist.name: artist
xmpDM:artist.definition: The name of the artist or artists.

xmpDM:audioChannelType.name: audioChannelType
xmpDM:audioChannelType.definition: The audio channel type. One of: Mono, Stereo, 5.1, 7.1, 16 Channel, Other

xmpDM:audioCompressor.name: audioCompressor
xmpDM:audioCompressor.definition: The audio compression used. For example, MP3.

xmpDM:audioSampleRate.name: audioSampleRate
xmpDM:audioSampleRate.definition: The audio sample rate. Can be any value, but commonly 32000, 44100, or 48000.

xmpDM:audioSampleType.name: audioSampleType
xmpDM:audioSampleType.definition: The audio sample type. One of: 8Int, 16Int, 24Int, 32Int, 32Float, Compressed, Packed,Other

xmpDM:beatSpliceParams.name: beatSpliceParams
xmpDM:beatSpliceParams.definition: Additional parameters for Beat Splice stretch mode.

xmpDM:cameraAngle.name: cameraAngle
xmpDM:cameraAngle.definition: The orientation of the camera to the subject in a static shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include: Low Angle, Eye Level, High Angle, Overhead Shot, Birds Eye Shot, Dutch Angle, POV, Over the Shoulder, Reaction Shot

xmpDM:cameraLabel.name: cameraLabel
xmpDM:cameraLabel.definition: A description of the camera used for a shoot. Can be any string, but is usually simply a number, for example '1', '2', or more explicitly 'Camera 1'

xmpDM:cameraModel.name: cameraModel
xmpDM:cameraModel.definition: The make and model of the camera used for a shoot.

xmpDM:cameraMove.name: cameraMove
xmpDM:cameraMove.definition: The movement of the camera during the shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include: Aerial, Boom Up, Boom Down, Crane Up, Crane Down, Dolly In, Dolly Out, Pan Left, Pan Right, Pedestal Up, Pedestal Down, Tilt Up, Tilt Down, Tracking, Truck Left, Truck Right, Zoom In, Zoom Out

xmpDM:client.name: client
xmpDM:client.definition: The client for the job of which this shot or take is a part.

xmpDM:contributedMedia.name: contributedMedia
xmpDM:contributedMedia.definition: An unordered list of all media used to create this media.

xmpDM:directorPhotography.name: directorPhotography
xmpDM:directorPhotography.definition: The director of photography for the scene.

xmpDM:duration.name: duration
xmpDM:duration.definition: The duration of the media file.

xmpDM:fileDataRate.name: fileDataRate
xmpDM:fileDataRate.definition: The file data rate in megabytes per second. For example: '36/10' = 3.6 MB/sec

xmpDM:good.name: good
xmpDM:good.definition: A checkbox for tracking whether a shot is a keeper.

xmpDM:introTime.name: introTime
xmpDM:introTime.definition: The duration of lead time for queuing music.

xmpDM:key.name: key
xmpDM:key.definition: The audio’s musical key. One of: C, C#, D, D#, E, F, F#, G, G#, A, A#, B

xmpDM:loop.name: loop
xmpDM:loop.definition: When true, the clip can be looped seamlessly.

xmpDM:numberOfBeats.name: numberOfBeats
xmpDM:numberOfBeats.definition: The total number of musical beats in a clip; for example, the beats-per-second times the duration in seconds.

xmpDM:markers.name: markers
xmpDM:markers.definition: An ordered list of markers. See also xmpDM:Tracks.

xmpDM:outCue.name: outCue
xmpDM:outCue.definition: The time at which to fade out.

xmpDM:projectName.name: projectName
xmpDM:projectName.definition: The name of the project of which this file is a part.

xmpDM:projectRef.name: projectRef
xmpDM:projectRef.definition: A reference to the project of which this file is a part.

xmpDM:pullDown.name: pullDown
xmpDM:pullDown.definition: The sampling phase of film to be converted to video (pull-down). One of: WSSWW, SSWWW, SWWWS, WWWSS, WWSSW, WWWSW, WWSWW, WSWWW, SWWWW, WWWWS

xmpDM:relativePeakAudioFilePath.name: relativePeakAudioFilePath
xmpDM:relativePeakAudioFilePath.definition: The relative path to the file’s peak audio file. If empty, no peak file exists.

xmpDM:relativeTimestamp.name: relativeTimestamp
xmpDM:relativeTimestamp.definition: The start time of the media inside the audio project.

xmpDM:releaseDate.name: releaseDate
xmpDM:releaseDate.definition: The date the title was released.

xmpDM:resampleParams.name: resampleParams
xmpDM:resampleParams.definition: Additional parameters for Resample stretch mode.

xmpDM:scaleType.name: scaleType
xmpDM:scaleType.definition: The musical scale used in the music. One of: Major, Minor, Both, Neither. Neither is most often used for instruments with no associated scale, such as drums.

xmpDM:shotDate.name: shotDate
xmpDM:shotDate.definition: The date and time when the video was shot.

xmpDM:shotDay.name: shotDay
xmpDM:shotDay.definition: The day in a multiday shoot. For example: Day 2, Friday.

xmpDM:shotLocation.name: shotLocation
xmpDM:shotLocation.definition: The name of the location where the video was shot. For example: 'Oktoberfest, Munich Germany'. For more accurate positioning, use the EXIF GPS values.

xmpDM:shotName.name: shotName
xmpDM:shotName.definition: The name of the shot or take.

xmpDM:shotNumber.name: shotNumber
xmpDM:shotNumber.definition: The position of the shot in a script or production, relative to other shots. For example: 1, 2, 1a, 1b, 1.1, 1.2.

xmpDM:shotSize.name: shotSize
xmpDM:shotSize.definition: The size or scale of the shot framing, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include: ECU (extreme close-up), MCU (medium close-up), CU (close-up), MS (medium shot), WS (wide shot), MWS (medium wide shot), EWS (extreme wide shot).

xmpDM:speakerPlacement.name: speakerPlacement
xmpDM:speakerPlacement.definition: A description of the speaker angles from centre front in degrees. For example: “Left = -30, Right = 30, Centre = 0, LFE = 45, Left Surround = -110, Right Surround = 110”

xmpDM:startTimecode.name: startTimecode
xmpDM:startTimecode.definition: The timecode of the first frame of video in the file, as obtained from the device control.

xmpDM:stretchMode.name: stretchMode
xmpDM:stretchMode.definition: The audio stretch mode. One of: Fixed length, Time-Scale, Resample, Beat Splice, Hybrid

xmpDM:takeNumber.name: takeNumber
xmpDM:takeNumber.definition: A numeric value indicating the absolute number of a take.

xmpDM:tapeName.name: tapeName
xmpDM:tapeName.definition: The name of the tape from which the clip was captured, as set during the capture process.

xmpDM:timeScaleParams.name: timeScaleParams
xmpDM:timeScaleParams.definition: Additional parameters for Time-Scale stretch mode.

xmpDM:timeSignature.name: timeSignature
xmpDM:timeSignature.definition: The time signature of the music. One of: 2/4, 3/4, 4/4, 5/4, 7/4, 6/8, 9/8, 12/8, other

xmpDM:trackNumber.name: trackNumber
xmpDM:trackNumber.definition: A numeric value indicating the order of the audio file within its original recording.

xmpDM:Tracks.name: tracks
xmpDM:Tracks.definition: An unordered list of tracks. A track is a named set of markers, which can specify a frame rate for all markers in the set. See also xmpDM:markers.

xmpDM:videoAlphaMode.name: videoAlphaMode
xmpDM:videoAlphaMode.definition: The alpha mode. One of: straight, pre-multiplied, or none.

xmpDM:videoAlphaPremultipleColor.name: videoAlphaPremultipleColor
xmpDM:videoAlphaPremultipleColor.definition: A colour in CMYK or RGB to be used as the premultiple colour when alpha mode is premultiplied.

xmpDM:videoAlphaUnityIsTransparent.name: videoAlphaUnityIsTransparent
xmpDM:videoAlphaUnityIsTransparent.definition: When true, unity is clear, when false, it is opaque.

xmpDM:videoColorSpace.name: videoColorSpace
xmpDM:videoColorSpace.definition: The colour space. One of: sRGB (used by Photoshop), CCIR-601 (used for NTSC), CCIR-709 (used for HD).

xmpDM:videoCompressor.name: videoCompressor
xmpDM:videoCompressor.definition: Video compression used. For example, jpeg.

xmpDM:videoFieldOrder.name: videoFieldOrder
xmpDM:videoFieldOrder.definition: The field order for video. One of: Upper, Lower, Progressive

xmpDM:videoFrameRate.name: videoFrameRate
xmpDM:videoFrameRate.definition: The video frame rate. Predefined values include: 24, NTSC, PAL

xmpDM:videoFrameSize.name: videoFrameSize
xmpDM:videoFrameSize.definition: The frame size. For example: w:720, h: 480, unit:pixels

xmpDM:videoPixelAspectRatio.name: videoPixelAspectRatio
xmpDM:videoPixelAspectRatio.definition: The aspect ratio, expressed as wd/ht. For example: “648/720” = 0.9

xmpDM:videoPixelDepth.name: videoPixelDepth
xmpDM:videoPixelDepth.definition: The size in bits of each colour component of a pixel. Standard Windows 32-bit pixels have 8 bits per component. One of: 8Int, 16Int, 24Int, 32Int, 32Float, Other

xmpDM:lyrics.name: lyrics
xmpDM:lyrics.definition: Lyrics text. No association with timecode.

xmpDM:discNumber.name: discNumber
xmpDM:discNumber.definition: If in a multi-disc set, might contain total number of discs. For example: 2/3.

rights_management.name: rights_management
rights_management.label: XMP Rights Management namespace
rights_management.definition: The XMP Rights Management namespace contains properties that provide information regarding the legal restrictions associated with a resource.

xmpRights:Certificate.name: Certificate
xmpRights:Certificate.definition: A web URL for a rights management certificate. NOTE: This is a normal (non-URI) simple value because of historical usage.

xmpRights:Marked.name: Marked
xmpRights:Marked.definition: When true, indicates that this is a rights-managed resource. When false, indicates that this is a public-domain resource. Omit if the state is unknown.

xmpRights:Owner.name: Owner
xmpRights:Owner.definition: A list of legal owners of the resource.

xmpRights:UsageTerms.name: UsageTerms
xmpRights:UsageTerms.definition: A collection of text instructions on how a resource can be legally used, given in a variety of languages.

xmpRights:WebStatement.name: WebStatement
xmpRights:WebStatement.definition: A Web URL for a statement of the ownership and usage rights for this resource. NOTE: This is a normal (non-URI) simple value because of historical usage.

adobe_pdf.name: adobe_pdf
adobe_pdf.label: Adobe PDF namespace
adobe_pdf.definition: This namespace specifies properties used with Adobe PDF documents.

pdf:PDFVersion.name: PDFVersion
pdf:PDFVersion.definition: The PDF file version (for example: 1.0, 1.3, and so on).

pdf:Producer.name: producer
pdf:Producer.definition: The name of the tool that created the PDF document.

pdf:Trapped.name: trapped
pdf:Trapped.definition: True when the document has been trapped.

photoshop.name: photoshop
photoshop.label: Photoshop namespace
photoshop.definition: This namespace specifies properties used by Adobe Photoshop.

photoshop:ColorMode.name: colorMode
photoshop:ColorMode.definition: The colour mode. One of: 0 = Bitmap , 1 = Gray scale, 2 = Indexed colour, 3 = RGB colour, 4 = CMYK colour, 7 = Multi-channel, 8 = Duotone, 9 = LAB colour

photoshop:DocumentAncestors.name: documentAncestors
photoshop:DocumentAncestors.definition: If the source document for a copy-and-paste or place operation has a document ID, that ID is added to this list in the destination document's XMP.

photoshop:History.name: history
photoshop:History.definition: The history that appears in the FileInfo panel, if activated in the application preferences.

photoshop:ICCProfile.name: ICCProfile
photoshop:ICCProfile.definition: The colour profile, such as AppleRGB, AdobeRGB1998.

photoshop:TextLayers.name: textLayers
photoshop:TextLayers.definition: If a document has text layers, this property caches the text for each layer.

photoshop:DateCreated.name: dateCreated
photoshop:DateCreated.definition: The date the intellectual content of the document was created, rather than the creation date of the physical representation.

camera_raw.name: camera_raw
camera_raw.label: Camera Raw namespace
camera_raw.definition: This namespace specifies settings associated with image files produced in camera raw mode.

crs:AutoBrightness.name: autoBrightness
crs:AutoBrightness.definition: When true, brightness is automatically adjusted.

crs:AutoContrast.name: autoContrast
crs:AutoContrast.definition: When true, contrast is automatically adjusted.

crs:AutoExposure.name: autoExposure
crs:AutoExposure.definition: When true, exposure is automatically adjusted.

crs:AutoShadows.name: autoShadows
crs:AutoShadows.definition: When true, shadows are automatically adjusted.

crs:ChromaticAberrationB.name: chromaticAberrationB
crs:ChromaticAberrationB.definition: Chomatic Aberration, Fix Blue/Yellow Fringe setting. Range -100 to +100.

crs:ChromaticAberrationR.name: chromaticAberrationR
crs:ChromaticAberrationR.definition: Chomatic Aberration, Fix Red/Cyan Fringe setting. Range -100 to +100.

crs:ColorNoiseReduction.name: colorNoiseReduction
crs:ColorNoiseReduction.definition: Color Noise Reducton setting. Range 0 to 100.

crs:CropTop.name: cropTop
crs:CropTop.definition: When Has Crop is true, top of crop rectangle.

crs:CropLeft.name: cropLeft
crs:CropLeft.definition: When Has Crop is true, left of crop rectangle.

crs:CropBottom.name: cropBottom
crs:CropBottom.definition: When Has Crop is true, bottom of crop rectangle.

crs:CropRight.name: cropRight
crs:CropRight.definition: When Has Crop is true, right of crop rectangle.

crs:CropAngle.name: cropAngle
crs:CropAngle.definition: When Has Crop is true, angle of crop rectangle.

crs:CropWidth.name: cropWidth
crs:CropWidth.definition: Width of resulting cropped image in CropUnits units.

crs:CropHeight.name: cropHeight
crs:CropHeight.definition: Height of resulting cropped image in CropUnits units.

crs:CropUnits.name: cropUnits
crs:CropUnits.definition: Units for Crop Width and Crop Height. One of: 0=pixels 1=inches 2=cm.

crs:HasCrop.name: hasCrop
crs:HasCrop.definition: When true, image has a cropping rectangle.

crs:HasSettings.name: hasSettings
crs:HasSettings.definition: When true, non-default camera raw settings.

crs:RawFileName.name: rawFileName
crs:RawFileName.definition: File name for raw file (not a complete path).

crs:ToneCurve.name: toneCurve
crs:ToneCurve.definition: Array of points (Integer, Integer) defining a tone curve.

crs:ToneCurveName.name: toneCurveName
crs:ToneCurveName.definition: The name of the Tone Curve described by ToneCurve. One of: Linear , Medium Contrast , Strong Contrast, Custom, or a user-defined preset name.

crs:WhiteBalance.name: whiteBalance
crs:WhiteBalance.definition: White Balance setting. One of: As Shot, Auto, Daylight, Cloudy, Shade, Tungsten, Fluorescent, Flash, Custom

exif.name: exif
exif.label: EXIF namespace
exif.definition: EXIF schema for EXIF-specific properties. These properties are defined solely by EXIF.

exif:ApertureValue.name: apertureValue
exif:ApertureValue.definition: EXIF tag 37378, 0x9202. Lens aperture, unit is APEX.

exif:BrightnessValue.name: brightnessValue
exif:BrightnessValue.definition: EXIF tag 37379, 0x9203. Brightness, unit is APEX.

exif:CFAPattern.name: CFAPattern
exif:CFAPattern.definition: EXIF tag 41730, 0xA302. Color filter array geometric pattern of the image sense.

exif:ColorSpace.name: colorSpace
exif:ColorSpace.definition: EXIF tag 40961, 0xA001. Color space information: 1 = sRGB, 65535 = uncalibrated

exif:CompressedBitsPerPixel.name: compressedBitsPerPixel
exif:CompressedBitsPerPixel.definition: EXIF tag 37122, 0x9102. Compression mode used for a compressed image is indicated in unit bits per pixel.

exif:Contrast.name: contrast
exif:Contrast.definition: EXIF tag 41992, 0xA408. Indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera: 0 = Normal, 1 = Soft, 2 = Hard

exif:CustomRendered.name: customRendered
exif:CustomRendered.definition: EXIF tag 41985, 0xA401. Indicates the use of special processing on image data: 0 = Normal process, 1 = Custom process

exif:DateTimeDigitized.name: dateTimeDigitized
exif:DateTimeDigitized.definition: EXIF tag 36868, 0x9004 (primary) and 37522, 0x9292 (subseconds). Date and time when image was stored as digital data, can be the same as DateTimeOriginal if originally stored in digital form. Stored in ISO 8601 format. Includes the EXIF SubSecTimeDigitized data. This value is used in XMP as xmp:CreateDate

exif:DateTimeOriginal.name: dateTimeOriginal
exif:DateTimeOriginal.definition: EXIF tags 36867, 0x9003 (primary) and 37521, 0x9291 (subseconds). Date and time when original image was generated, in ISO 8601 format. Includes the EXIF SubSecTimeOriginal data. Note that Exif date-time values have no time zone information.

exif:DeviceSettingDescription.name: deviceSettingDescription
exif:DeviceSettingDescription.definition: EXIF tag 41995, 0xA40B. Indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model.

exif:DigitalZoomRatio.name: digitalZoomRatio
exif:DigitalZoomRatio.definition: EXIF tag 41988, 0xA404. Indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot.

exif:ExposureBiasValue.name: exposureBiasValue
exif:ExposureBiasValue.definition: EXIF tag 37380, 0x9204. Exposure bias, unit is APEX.

exif:ExposureIndex.name: exposureIndex
exif:ExposureIndex.definition: EXIF tag 41493, 0xA215. Exposure index of input device.

exif:ExposureMode.name: exposureMode
exif:ExposureMode.definition: EXIF tag 41986, 0xA402. Indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot: 0 = Auto exposure, 1 = Manual exposure, 2 = Auto bracket

exif:ExposureProgram.name: exposureProgram
exif:ExposureProgram.definition: EXIF tag 34850, 0x8822. Class of program used for exposure: 0 = not defined, 1 = Manual, 2 = Normal program, 3 = Aperture priority, 4 = Shutter priority, 5 = Creative program, 6 = Action program, 7 = Portrait mode, 8 = Landscape mode

exif:ExposureTime.name: exposureTime
exif:ExposureTime.definition: EXIF tag 33434, 0x829A. Exposure time in seconds.

exif:FileSource.name: fileSource
exif:FileSource.definition: EXIF tag 41728, 0xA300. Indicates image source: 3 (DSC) is the only choice.

exif:Flash.name: flash
exif:Flash.definition: EXIF tag 37385, 0x9209. Strobe light (flash) source data.

exif:FlashEnergy.name: flashEnergy
exif:FlashEnergy.definition: EXIF tag 41483, 0xA20B. Strobe energy during image capture.

exif:FocalLength.name: focalLength
exif:FocalLength.definition: EXIF tag 37386, 0x920A. Focal length of the lens, in millimeters.

exif:FocalLengthIn35mmFilm.name: FocalLengthIn35mmFilm
exif:FocalLengthIn35mmFilm.definition: EXIF tag 41989, 0xA405. Indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm. A value of 0 means the focal length is unknown. Note that this tag differs from the FocalLength tag.

exif:FocalPlaneResolutionUnit.name: focalPlaneResolutionUnit
exif:FocalPlaneResolutionUnit.definition: EXIF tag 41488, 0xA210. Unit used for FocalPlaneXResolution and FocalPlaneYResolution. 2 = inches, 3 = centimeters

exif:FocalPlaneXResolution.name: focalPlaneXResolution
exif:FocalPlaneXResolution.definition: EXIF tag 41486, 0xA20E. Horizontal focal resolution, measured pixels per unit.

exif:FocalPlaneYResolution.name: focalPlaneYResolution
exif:FocalPlaneYResolution.definition: EXIF tag 41487, 0xA20F. Vertical focal resolution, measured in pixels per unit.

exif:GainControl.name: gainControl
exif:GainControl.definition: EXIF tag 41991, 0xA407. Indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment: 0 = None, 1 = Low gain up, 2 = High gain up, 3 = Low gain down, 4 = High gain down

exif:ImageUniqueID.name: imageUniqueID
exif:ImageUniqueID.definition: EXIF tag 42016, 0xA420. An identifier assigned uniquely to each image. It is recorded as a 32 character ASCII string, equivalent to hexadecimal notation and 128-bit fixed length.

exif:ISOSpeedRatings.name: ISOSpeedRatings
exif:ISOSpeedRatings.definition: EXIF tag 34855, 0x8827. ISO Speed and ISO Latitude of the input device as specified in ISO 12232. A native Exif ISO value of exactly 65535 indicates an ISO value of above 64K, which cannot be stored in the native Exif Tag 34855. The real value should be stored in the XMP.

exif:LightSource.name: lightSource
exif:LightSource.definition: EXIF tag 37384, 0x9208. Light source: 0 = unknown, 1 = Daylight, 2 = Fluorescent, 3 = Tungsten, 4 = Flash, 9 = Fine weather, 10 = Cloudy weather, 11 = Shade, 12 = Daylight fluorescent (D 5700 – 7100K), 13 = Day white fluorescent (N 4600 – 5400K), 14 = Cool white fluorescent (W 3900 – 4500K), 15 = White fluorescent (WW 3200 – 3700K), 17 = Standard light A, 18 = Standard light B, 19 = Standard light C, 20 = D55, 21 = D65, 22 = D75, 23 = D50, 24 = ISO studio tungsten, 255 = other

exif:MaxApertureValue.name: maxApertureValue
exif:MaxApertureValue.definition: EXIF tag 37381, 0x9205. Smallest F number of lens, in APEX.

exif:MeteringMode.name: meteringMode
exif:MeteringMode.definition: EXIF tag 37383, 0x9207. Metering mode: 0 = unknown, 1 = Average, 2 = CenterWeightedAverage, 3 = Spot, 4 = MultiSpot, 5 = Pattern, 6 = Partial, 255 = other

exif:OECF.name: OECF
exif:OECF.definition: EXIF tag 34856, 0x8828. Opto-Electoric Conversion Function as specified in ISO 14524.

exif:PixelXDimension.name: pixelXDimension
exif:PixelXDimension.definition: EXIF tag 40962, 0xA002. Valid image width, in pixels.

exif:PixelYDimension.name: pixelYDimension
exif:PixelYDimension.definition: EXIF tag 40963, 0xA003. Valid image height, in pixels.

exif:RelatedSoundFile.name: relatedSoundFile
exif:RelatedSoundFile.definition: EXIF tag 40964, 0xA004. An 8.3 file name for the related sound file.

exif:Saturation.name: saturation
exif:Saturation.definition: EXIF tag 41993, 0xA409. Indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera: 0 = Normal, 1 = Low saturation, 2 = High saturation

exif:SceneCaptureType.name: sceneCaptureType
exif:SceneCaptureType.definition: EXIF tag 41990, 0xA406. Indicates the type of scene that was shot: 0 = Standard, 1 = Landscape, 2 = Portrait, 3 = Night scene

exif:SceneType.name: sceneType
exif:SceneType.definition: EXIF tag 41729, 0xA301. Indicates the type of scene: 1 (directly photographed image) is the only choice.

exif:SensingMethod.name: sensingMethod
exif:SensingMethod.definition: EXIF tag 41495, 0xA217. Image sensor type on input device: 1 = Not defined, 2 = One-chip colour area sensor, 3 = Two-chip colour area sensor, 4 = Three-chip colour area sensor, 5 = Colour sequential area sensor, 7 = Trilinear sensor, 8 = Colour sequential linear sensor

exif:Sharpness.name: sharpness
exif:Sharpness.definition: EXIF tag 41994, 0xA40A. Indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera: 0 = Normal, 1 = Soft, 2 = Hard

exif:ShutterSpeedValue.name: shutterSpeedValue
exif:ShutterSpeedValue.definition: EXIF tag 37377, 0x9201. Shutter speed, unit is APEX. See Annex C of the EXIF specification.

exif:SpatialFrequencyResponse.name: spatialFrequencyResponse
exif:SpatialFrequencyResponse.definition: EXIF tag 41484, 0xA20C. Input device spatial frequency table and SFR values as specified in ISO 12233.

exif:SpectralSensitivity.name: spectralSensitivity
exif:SpectralSensitivity.definition: EXIF tag 34852, 0x8824. Spectral sensitivity of each channel.

exif:SubjectArea.name: subjectArea
exif:SubjectArea.definition: EXIF tag 37396, 0x9214. The location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

exif:SubjectDistance.name: subjectDistance
exif:SubjectDistance.definition: EXIF tag 37382, 0x9206. Distance to subject, in meters.

exif:SubjectDistanceRange.name: subjectDistanceRange
exif:SubjectDistanceRange.definition: EXIF tag 41996, 0xA40C. Indicates the distance to the subject: 0 = Unknown, 1 = Macro, 2 = Close view, 3 = Distant view

exif:SubjectLocation.name: subjectLocation
exif:SubjectLocation.definition: EXIF tag 41492, 0xA214. Location of the main subject of the scene. The first value is the horizontal pixel and the second value is the vertical pixel at which the main subject appears.

exif:WhiteBalance.name: whiteBalance
exif:WhiteBalance.definition: EXIF tag 41987, 0xA403. Indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot: 0 = Auto white balance, 1 = Manual white balance.

exif:GPSAltitude.name: GPSAltitude
exif:GPSAltitude.definition: GPS tag 6, 0x06. Indicates altitude in meters.

exif:GPSAltitudeRef.name: GPSAltitudeRef
exif:GPSAltitudeRef.definition: GPS tag 5, 0x5. Indicates whether the altitude is above or below sea level: 0 = Above sea level, 1 = Below sea level

exif:GPSAreaInformation.name: GPSAreaInformation
exif:GPSAreaInformation.definition: GPS tag 28, 0x1C. A character string recording the name of the GPS area.

exif:GPSDestBearing.name: GPSDestBearing
exif:GPSDestBearing.definition: GPS tag 24, 0x18. Destination bearing, values from 0 to 359.99.

exif:GPSDestBearingRef.name: GPSDestBearingRef
exif:GPSDestBearingRef.definition: GPS tag 23, 0x17. Reference for movement direction: T = true direction, M = magnetic direction

exif:GPSDestDistanceRef.name: GPSDestDistanceRef
exif:GPSDestDistanceRef.definition: GPS tag 25, 0x19. Units used for speed measurement: "K" = kilometers, "M" = miles, "N" = knots

exif:GPSDestLatitude.name: GPSDestLatitude
exif:GPSDestLatitude.definition: GPS tag 20, 0x14 (position) and 19, 0x13 (North/South). Indicates destination latitude.

exif:GPSDestLongitude.name: GPSDestLongitude
exif:GPSDestLongitude.definition: GPS tag 22, 0x16 (position) and 21, 0x15 (East/West). Indicates destination longitude.

exif:GPSDifferential.name: GPSDifferential
exif:GPSDifferential.definition: GPS tag 30, 0x1E. Indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver: 0 = Without correction, 1 = Correction applied

exif:GPSDOP.name: GPSDOP
exif:GPSDOP.definition: GPS tag 11, 0x0B. Degree of precision for GPS data.

exif:GPSImgDirection.name: GPSImgDirection
exif:GPSImgDirection.definition: GPS tag 17, 0x11. Direction of image when captured, values range from 0 to 359.99.

exif:GPSImgDirectionRef.name: GPSImgDirectionRef
exif:GPSImgDirectionRef.definition: GPS tag 16, 0x10. Reference for movement direction: "T" = true direction, "M" = magnetic direction

exif:GPSMeasureMode.name: GPSMeasureMode
exif:GPSMeasureMode.definition: GPS tag 10, 0x0A. GPS measurement mode, Text type: "2" = two-dimensional measurement, "3" = three-dimensional measurement.

exif:GPSProcessingMethod.name: GPSProcessingMethod
exif:GPSProcessingMethod.definition: GPS tag 27, 0x1B. A character string recording the name of the method used for location finding.

exif:GPSSatellites.name: GPSSatellites
exif:GPSSatellites.definition: GPS tag 8, 0x08. Satellite information, format is unspecified.

exif:GPSSpeed.name: GPSSpeed
exif:GPSSpeed.definition: GPS tag 13, 0x0D. Speed of GPS receiver movement.

exif:GPSSpeedRef.name: GPSSpeedRef
exif:GPSSpeedRef.definition: GPS tag 12, 0x0C. Units used for speed measurement: "K" = kilometers per hour, "M" = miles per hour, "N" = knots

exif:GPSStatus.name: GPSStatus
exif:GPSStatus.definition: GPS tag 9, 0x09. Status of GPS receiver at image creation time: "A" = measurement in progress, "V" = measurement is interoperability

exif:GPSTimeStamp.name: GPSTimeStamp
exif:GPSTimeStamp.definition: GPS tag 29 (date), 0x1D, and, and GPS tag 7 (time), 0x07. Time stamp of GPS data, in Coordinated Universal Time. NOTE: The GPSDateStamp tag is new in EXIF 2.2. The GPS timestamp in EXIF 2.1 does not include a date. If not present, the date component for the XMP should be taken from exif:DateTimeOriginal, or if that is also lacking from exif:DateTimeDigitized. If no date is available, do not write exif:GPSTimeStamp to XMP.

exif:GPSTrack.name: GPSTrack
exif:GPSTrack.definition: GPS tag 15, 0x0F. Direction of GPS movement, values range from 0 to 359.99.

exif:GPSTrackRef.name: GPSTrackRef
exif:GPSTrackRef.definition: GPS tag 14, 0x0E. Reference for movement direction: "T" = true direction, "M" = magnetic direction

exif:GPSVersionID.name: GPSVersionID
exif:GPSVersionID.definition: GPS tag 0, 0x00. A decimal encoding of each of the four EXIF bytes with period separators. The current value is "2.3.0.0".

tiff:Artist.name: artist
tiff:Artist.definition: Camera owner, photographer or image creator. NOTE: This property is stored in XMP as the first item in the dc:creator array.

tiff:BitsPerSample.name: bitsPerSample
tiff:BitsPerSample.definition: Number of bits per component in each channel.

tiff:Copyright.name: Copyright
tiff:Copyright.definition: Copyright information as an ASCII string. NOTE: This property is stored in XMP as dc:rights.

tiff:DateTime.name: DateTime
tiff:DateTime.definition: Date and time when the file was last modified (no time zone in EXIF), stored in ISO 8601 format, not the original EXIF format. This property includes the value for the EXIF SubSecTime(37520, 0x9290) attribute. NOTE: This property is stored in XMP as xmp:ModifyDate.

tiff:ImageDescription.name: ImageDescription
tiff:ImageDescription.definition: The title of the image as an ASCII string. NOTE: This property is stored in XMP as dc:description.

tiff:Make.name: Make
tiff:Make.definition: Manufacturer of recording equipment as an ASCII string.

tiff:Model.name: Model
tiff:Model.definition: Model name or number of equipment as an ASCII string.

tiff:Orientation.name: Orientation
tiff:Orientation.definition: Orientation: 1 = 0th row at the top, 0th column at left, 2 = 0th row at the top, 0th column at right, 3 = 0th row at the bottom, 0th column at right, 4 = 0th row at the bottom, 0th column at left, 5 = 0th row at the left, 0th column at top, 6 = 0th row at the right, 0th column at top, 7 = 0th row at the right, 0th column at bottom, 8 = 0th row at the left, 0th column at bottom.

tiff:PrimaryChromaticities.name: primaryChromaticities
tiff:PrimaryChromaticities.definition: Chromaticity of the three primary colors.

tiff:ReferenceBlackWhite.name: referenceBlackWhite
tiff:ReferenceBlackWhite.definition: Reference black and white point values.

tiff:ResolutionUnit.name: resolutionUnit
tiff:ResolutionUnit.definition: Unit used for XResolution and YResolution. Value is one of 2 = Inches, 3 = Centimeters.

tiff:Software.name: software
tiff:Software.definition: Software or firmware used to generate image. NOTE: This property is stored in XMP as xmp:CreatorTool.

tiff:TransferFunction.name: transferFunction
tiff:TransferFunction.definition: Transfer function for image described in tabular style with 3 * 256 entries.

tiff:XResolution.name: XResolution
tiff:XResolution.definition: Horizontal resolution in pixels per unit.

tiff:YResolution.name: YResolution
tiff:YResolution.definition: Vertical resolution in pixels per unit.

tiff:YCbCrCoefficients.name: YCbCrCoefficients
tiff:YCbCrCoefficients.definition: Matrix coefficients for RGB to YCbCr transformation.

tiff:YCbCrPositioning.name: YCbCrPositioning
tiff:YCbCrPositioning.definition: Position of chrominance vs. luminance components: 1 = centered, 2 = co-sited.

tiff:YCbCrSubSampling.name: YCbCrSubSampling
tiff:YCbCrSubSampling.definition: Sampling ratio of chrominance components: [2,1] = YCbCr4:2:2, [2,2] = YCbCr4:2:0.

dc.name: dc
dc.label: Dublin Core namespace
dc.definition: The Dublin Core namespace provides a set of commonly used properties. The names and usage shall be as defined in the Dublin Core Metadata Element Set, created by the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative (DCMI).

dc:contributor.name: Contributor
dc:contributor.definition: DCMI definition: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource. DCMI comment: Examples of a contributor include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a contributor should be used to indicate the entity. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of contributors. These contributors should not include those listed in dc:creator.

dc:coverage.name: Coverage
dc:coverage.definition: DCMI definition: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant. XMP addition: XMP usage is the extent or scope of the resource.

dc:creator.name: Creator
dc:creator.definition: DCMI definition: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource. DCMI comment: Examples of a creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a creator should be used to indicate the entity. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of creators. Entities should be listed in order of decreasing precedence, if such order is significant.

dc:date.name: date
dc:date.definition: DCMI definition: A point or period of time associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource.

dc:description.name: Description
dc:description.definition: DCMI definition: An account of the resource. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of textual descriptions of the content of the resource, given in various languages.

dc:format.name: Format
dc:format.definition: DCMI definition: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource. DCMI comment: Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the list of Internet Media Types [MIME]. XMP addition: XMP usage is a MIME type. Dimensions would be stored using a media-specific property, beyond the scope of this document.

dc:identifier.name: Identifier
dc:identifier.definition: DCMI definition: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context. DCMI comment: Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

dc:language.name: Language
dc:language.definition: DCMI definition: A language of the resource. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of languages used in the content of the resource.

dc:publisher.name: Publisher
dc:publisher.definition: DCMI definition: An entity responsible for making the resource available. DCMI comment: Examples of a publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a publisher should be used to indicate the entity. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of publishers.

dc:relation.name: Relation
dc:relation.definition: DCMI definition: A related resource.DCMI comment: Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of related resources.

dc:rights.name: Rights
dc:rights.definition: DCMI definition: Information about rights held in and over the resource. DCMI comment: Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of informal rights statements, given in various languages.

dc:source.name: Source
dc:source.definition: DCMI definition: A related resource from which the described resource is derived. DCMI comment: The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

dc:subject.name: Subject
dc:subject.definition: DCMI definition: The topic of the resource.DCMI comment: Typically, the subject will be represented using keywords, key phrases, or classification codes. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. To describe the spatial or temporal topic of the resource, use the dc:coverage element. XMP addition: XMP usage is a list of descriptive phrases or keywords that specify the content of the resource.

dc:title.name: Title
dc:title.definition: DCMI definition: A name given to the resource. DCMI comment: Typically, a title will be a name by which the resource is formally known. XMP addition: XMP usage is a title or name, given in various languages.

dc:type.name: Type
dc:type.definition: DCMI definition: The nature or genre of the resource. DCMI comment: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMITYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the dc:format element. XMP addition: See the dc:format entry for clarification of the XMP usage of that element.

iptc_core.name: iptc_core
iptc_core.label: IPTC Core namespace
iptc_core.definition: IPTC Photo Metadata provides data about photographs and the values can be processed by software. Each individual metadata entity is called a property and they are grouped into Administrative, Descriptive and Rights Related properties.

Iptc4xmpCore:CreatorContactInfo.name: creatorContactInfo
Iptc4xmpCore:CreatorContactInfo.definition: The creator contact information provides all necessary information to get in contact with the creator of this news object and comprises a set of sub-properties for proper addressing.

Iptc4xmpCore:IntellectualGenre.name: intellectualGenre
Iptc4xmpCore:IntellectualGenre.definition: Describes the nature, intellectual or journalistic characteristic of a news object, not specifically its content.

Iptc4xmpCore:Scene.name: scene
Iptc4xmpCore:Scene.definition: Describes the scene of a photo content. Specifies one ore more terms from the IPTC Scene-NewsCodes. Each Scene is represented as a string of 6 digits in an unordered list.

Iptc4xmpCore:Location.name: location
Iptc4xmpCore:Location.definition: Name of a location the content is focussing on – either the location shown in visual media or referenced by text or audio media. This location name could either be the name of a sublocation to a city or the name of a well known location or (natural) monument outside a city. In the sense of a sublocation to a city this element is at the fourth level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.

Iptc4xmpCore:CountryCode.name: countryCode
Iptc4xmpCore:CountryCode.definition: Code of the country the content is focussing on – either the country shown in visual media or referenced in text or audio media. This element is at the top/first level of a top-down geographical hierarchy. The code should be taken from ISO 3166 two or three letter code. The full name of a country should go to the "Country" element.

Iptc4xmpCore:SubjectCode.name: subjectCode
Iptc4xmpCore:SubjectCode.definition: Specifies one or more Subjects from the IPTC Subject-NewsCodes taxonomy to categorize the content. Each Subject is represented as a string of 8 digits in an unordered list.

iptc_extended.name: iptc_extended
iptc_extended.label: IPTC Extended namespace
iptc_extended.definition: IPTC Photo Metadata provides data about photographs and the values can be processed by software. Each individual metadata entity is called a property and they are grouped into Administrative, Descriptive and Rights Related properties.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCircaDateCreated.name: AOCircaDateCreated
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCircaDateCreated.definition: Approximate date or range of dates associated with the creation and production of an artwork or object or its components.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOContentDescription.name: AOContentDescription
Iptc4xmpExt:AOContentDescription.definition: A textual description of the content depicted in the artwork or object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOContributionDescription.name: AOContributionDescription
Iptc4xmpExt:AOContributionDescription.definition: A textual description about a contribution made to an artwork or an object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCopyrightNotice.name: AOCopyrightNotice
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCopyrightNotice.definition: Contains any necessary copyright notice for claiming the intellectual property for artwork or an object in the image and should identify the current owner of the copyright of this work with associated intellectual property rights.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCreator.name: AOCreator
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCreator.definition: Contains the name of the artist who has created artwork or an object in the image. In cases where the artist could or should not be identified the name of a company or organisation may be appropriate.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCreatorID.name: AOCreatorID
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCreatorID.definition: Globally unique identifier for the creator of artwork or object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentCopyrightOwnerID.name: AOCurrentCopyrightOwnerID
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentCopyrightOwnerID.definition: Globally unique identifier for the current owner of the copyright of the artwork or object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentCopyrightOwnerName.name: AOCurrentCopyrightOwnerName
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentCopyrightOwnerName.definition: Name of the current owner of the copyright of the artwork or object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentLicensorID.name: AOCurrentLicensorID
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentLicensorID.definition: Globally unique identifier for the current licensor of the artwork or object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentLicensorName.name: AOCurrentLicensorName
Iptc4xmpExt:AOCurrentLicensorName.definition: Name of the current licensor of the artwork or object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AODateCreated.name: AODateCreated
Iptc4xmpExt:AODateCreated.definition: Designates the date and optionally the time the artwork or object in the image was created. This relates to artwork or objects with associated intellectual property rights.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOPhysicalDescription.name: AOPhysicalDescription
Iptc4xmpExt:AOPhysicalDescription.definition: A textual description of the physical characteristics of the artwork or object, without reference to the content depicted.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOSource.name: AOSource
Iptc4xmpExt:AOSource.definition: The organisation or body holding and registering the artwork or object in the image for inventory purposes.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOSourceInvNo.name: AOSourceInvNo
Iptc4xmpExt:AOSourceInvNo.definition: The inventory number issued by the organisation or body holding and registering the artwork or object in the image.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOSourceInvURL.name: AOSourceInvURL
Iptc4xmpExt:AOSourceInvURL.definition: URL reference to the metadata record of the inventory maintained by the Source.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOStylePeriod.name: AOStylePeriod
Iptc4xmpExt:AOStylePeriod.definition: The style, historical or artistic period, movement, group, or school whose characteristics are represented in the artwork or object.

Iptc4xmpExt:AOTitle.name: AOTitle
Iptc4xmpExt:AOTitle.definition: A reference for the artwork or object in the image.
